pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:5.1: 40. The training rule on going wandering
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:6.2: At that time the nuns were staying right there at Rājagaha for the rainy season, for the cold season, and for the hot season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:6.4: “The districts are left dark and obscure by the nuns. They don’t brighten them up.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.3: who in turn told the Master.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.4: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.5: “Because of this, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the nuns for the following ten reasons:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.6: for the well-being of the Order …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.7: for the continuation of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:8.1: ‘If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not go wandering, even if only 65 to 80 kilometers, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:10.1: Who has completed the rainy-season residence:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:10.2: who has completed the first three or the last three months of the rainy season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:11.1: If she thinks, “I will not go wandering, not even 65 to 80 kilometers,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:12.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:13.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:13.2: The fourth chapter on lying down is finished.
